titleStmt.title: New England freemen warned and warmed to be free indeed, having an eye to God in their elections in a sermon preached before the Court of Election at Boston on the last day of May, 1671 [by] J.O., pastour of the first church in Boston.
titleStmt.author: Oxenbridge, John, 1609-1674.

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: pages torn with loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
